text: Pierre Agostini (; born 23 July 1941) is a French experimental physicist. He is an Emeritus professor at Ohio State University. He is known for his work in strong-field laser physics and attosecond science. He is also known for his invention of the reconstruction of attosecond beating by interference of two- photon transitions (RABBITT) technique. He was jointly awarded the 2023 Nobel Prize in Physics. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:French physicists Category:People from Tunis Category:Tunisian scientists
title: Pierre Agostini
